snippet: The District of Columbia can bar residents from owning assault weapons and require them to register their handguns without violating the Second Amendment, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The District of Columbia can bar residents from owning assault weapons and require them to register their handguns without violating the Second Amendment, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.

headline.main: Appeals Court Allows Ban on Assault Weapons
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Allows Ban on Assault Weapons
headline.seo: Appeals Court Allows Ban on Assault Weapons
